meanings.definition: To give a surname to someone.
meanings.sent1: She was surnaming her newborn baby with the family name.
meanings.sent2: The official was surnaming the citizens during the registration process.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked about surnaming the class pets for fun.
meanings.sent4: The tradition of surnaming has been passed down for generations.
meanings.sent5: Surnaming is an important cultural practice in many societies.

meanings.definition: The act of assigning a surname to someone.
meanings.sent1: The surnaming of the child was a special moment for the family.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the priest performed the surnaming of the couple.
meanings.sent3: The surnaming of the new employee caused some confusion in the office.
meanings.sent4: In history class, we learned about the origins of surnaming.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased the evolution of surnaming over time.
